boat.name: Papillon
boat.full_description:
1930 Built by Leslie W Harris in Burnham on Crouch in Essex.

1940 Operation Dynamo, Evacuation of BEF from Dunkirk.

Whilst owned by Mr C.P. Mackenrot, who lived at Westcliff-on-Sea, Essex 'Papillon' was commissioned for Operation Dynamo. She arrived for service at Dover on 30 May 1940 ready to go to Dunkirk, but her two 4 cylinder Morris petrol engines were 'defective'. It was noted that she had 30 gallons of petrol, a full crew and a minor electrical fault. A fault with her condenser was repaired. She was then loaded with six spare tins of petrol and water. There was a minor hiccup in that her civilian crew consisting of Skipper E. Sommers Holmwood of Kingston by Sea, S.J Downes of Shoreham, B.Hawood of Brighton and Mr Griffiths of Peacehaven were uncertain of their conditions of service. 'Papillon' eventually sailed for Dunkirk on 2 June and when she came back the next day, gave up her route order and had her fuel and oil tanks replenished.

1940 - 1941 Remained in Service with The Admiralty and provided local coastal and river patrols.

1941 - 1943 Laid up

1943 - 1945 Used for Fire Service duties until the end of the War

1951 Owned by Mr Stanley Howard of Ipswich

1988 Purchased in 1988 by Mr Richard Huggett of Erith Kent. 'Papillon' was in a poor state of repair. Mr and Mrs Huggett carried out an extensive refurbishment to make her seaworthy again.

1990 Sailed to Dunkirk for the 50th Anniversary with the Association of Dunkirk Little Ships (ADLS)

1997 Ian and Karina Gilbert bought 'Papillon' and kept her on the Thames at Weybridge

1997 - 2015 Attended Henley on Thames Traditional Boat Rally each year

2000, 2005, 2010 Attended Commemoration of Operation Dynamo from Ramsgate and return to Dunkirk

2012 Took part in Queens Golden Jubilee Regatta on Thames

2015 Commemoration of Operation Dynamo from Ramsgate and return to Dunkirk as flagship in 2015

Geoff Turner and Jodi Smith purchased 'Papillon' and took her to a new home in Cowes on the Isle of Wight.

2016 Sailed to Dunkirk to take part in the Christopher Nolan film, 'Dunkirk', to be released in July 2017
boat.short_description: Papillon is a motor boat built in 1930. She is a Dunkirk Little Ship.
